title: IDOR in User Profile Endpoint Exposes PII of All Users
vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The user profile endpoint at `/profile/<id>` is vulnerable to Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR). Any user can access any other user's profile, including sensitive PII (email, SSN, role), by simply changing the `id` path parameter.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Log in as a regular user (user id=2)
2. Access your own profile: `GET /profile/2`
3. Change the `id` parameter to another user's ID: `GET /profile/1`
4. The application returns the full profile of user 1 (admin), including their SSN and email
5. Iterate through IDs 1-5 to enumerate all users

## Proof of Concept
```http
GET /profile/1 HTTP/1.1
Host: target.com
```

Response contains:
```json
{"id": 1, "name": "Alice Admin", "email": "alice@company.com", "role": "admin", "ssn": "123-45-6789"}
```

The response includes the admin user's SSN and full profile without any authorization check.

## Impact
- Complete exposure of all user PII (names, emails, SSNs)
- Ability to enumerate all users in the system
- Admin account details exposed, enabling further targeted attacks
- Potential regulatory violation (PII exposure)
